SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

al6utils
Class DelimitedFileExporter

java.lang.Object
  al6utils.DelimitedFileExporter

public class DelimitedFileExporter
extends java.lang.Object

Construct a data set that can be arranged as rows of fields and export it to a delimited text file.

The number of data rows held in memory before writing to the output file is controlled by the calling code. The calling code could construct all rows in memory before writing to the output file. It could also write each row to the output file immediately after constructing it, maintaining only one row in memory at all times. Scenarios falling between these two extremes are also possible.

Data is flushed to the output file after every write operation. As a result, if the application crashes before the close method is called, the output file should contain all the rows that had been written prior to the crash.

Example of usage:

   DelimitedFileExporter exporter = null;

   try {
       exporter = new DelimitedFileExporter("myfile.txt", false, "\t", null);
   }
   catch (IOException e) {
       // handle the exception
   }

   // tell the exporter about all the fields in the data
   exporter.addField("ID");
   exporter.addField("Name");
   exporter.addField("Score");

   // write a header row containing the field names to the file
   exporter.writeHeaderRow();

   // add a data row and write it to the file
   exporter.startDataRow();
   exporter.addDataValue("ID", 1);
   exporter.addDataValue("Name", "Charlie Delta");
   exporter.addDataValue("Score", 0.267);
   exporter.writeDataRows();

   // add several data rows and write them all to the file in a group
   double[] scores = { 0.150, 0.212, 0.284, 0.313 };
   for (int i = 0; i < scores.length; i++) {
       exporter.startDataRow();
       exporter.addDataValue("ID", 2);
       exporter.addDataValue("Name", "Victor Tango");
       exporter.addDataValue("Score", scores[i]);
   }
   exporter.writeDataRows();

   // close the file
   exporter.close();

Constructor Detail

DelimitedFileExporter

public DelimitedFileExporter(java.lang.String filename,
                             boolean append,
                             java.lang.String fieldDelimiter,
                             java.lang.String lineTerminator)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Creates a DelimitedFileExporter that writes to the given file.

Parameters:
filename - the delimited text file to create
append - @{code true} if the data should be appended to the given file
fieldDelimiter - the text to be written between consecutive fields
lineTerminator - the text to be written at the end of each row. Set to null to use the default end-of-line text for the current platform.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while opening the file
Method Detail

addField

public void addField(java.lang.String fieldName)
Adds a field to this exporter object. The field will be written to all subsequent rows of the output file. Fields are written to the output file in the order in which they are added.

Parameters:
fieldName - name of the field to add. The name will appear in the output file's header row (if any) and is the name by which the field is accessed in calls to addDataValue.

removeField

public void removeField(java.lang.String fieldName)
Removes a field from this exporter object. The field will not be written to subsequent rows in the output file.

Parameters:
fieldName - name of the field to remove

startDataRow

public void startDataRow()
Creates a new, empty data row and makes it active. Subsequent calls to addDataValue will add data items to this new row.

addDataValue

public void addDataValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                         java.lang.String value)
Adds a String data value to a field in the active row. If the field already has a value, that value will be overwritten.

Parameters:
fieldName - the field for which a data value is provided
value - the data value

addDataValue

public void addDataValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                         int value)
Adds an int data value to a field in the active row. If the field already has a value, that value will be overwritten.

Parameters:
fieldName - the field for which a data value is provided
value - the data value

addDataValue

public void addDataValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                         double value)
Adds a double data value to a field in the active row. If the field already has a value, that value will be overwritten.

Parameters:
fieldName - the field for which a data value is provided
value - the data value

addDataValue

public void addDataValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                         boolean value)
Adds a boolean data value to a field in the active row. The value written to the file is either "true" or "false" (without quotes). If the field already has a value, that value will be overwritten.

Parameters:
fieldName - the field for which a data value is provided
value - the data value

addDataValue

public void addDataValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                         java.lang.Object value)
Adds an Object data value to a field in the active row. The value written to the file is taken from the Object's toString method. If the field already has a value, that value will be overwritten.

Parameters:
fieldName - the field for which a data value is provided
value - the data value

writeHeaderRow

public void writeHeaderRow()
Writes a line containing the field names to the output file. Consecutive field names are delimited by this object's field delimiter, and the line is terminated by this object's line terminator. The fields appear in the same order in which they were defined using addField.

writeDataRows

public void writeDataRows()
For each data row that has been defined since the last call to this method, writes a line containing the row's data values to the output file. Consecutive data values in a row are delimited by this object's field delimiter, and each line is terminated by this object's line terminator.

close

public void close()
Closes the output file.

writeLineTerminator

protected void writeLineTerminator()
Writes the appropriate line terminator to the output file. The appropriate line terminator is the one specified in the constructor, or, if unspecified, the default line terminator for the current platform.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O occurs while writing to the file
